question: Ethyl alcohol is heated with concentrated sulphuric acid at 413 K. The major product is
explanation: At 413 K, dehydration of ethanol with conc. <katex>$H_2SO_4$</katex> yields Diethyl ether (<katex>$C_{2}H_{5}-O-C_{2}H_{5}$</katex>).
At higher temperatures (443 K), it would yield ethene.
